SAFETY INSTRUCTIONS INSTRUCCIONE SPARALA SEGURIDAD
/
319
FEDERAL REGULATIONS REQUIRE COMPLIANCE WITH CREW INSTRUCTIONS, LIGHTED PASSENGER
INFORMATION SIGNS AND POSTED PLACARDS AT ALL TIMES. FOR YOUR SAFETY, PASSENGERS
MUST COMPLY WITH THE FASTEN SEAT BELT SIGN AND IT IS RECOMMENDED THAT YOU KEEP YOUR
SEATBELT FASTENED AT ALL TIMES WHILE SEATED. IF YOU ARE SEATED IN AN EXIT SEAT AND DO
NOT UNDERSTAND ENGLISH OR THE INFORMATION ON THIS CARD, PLEASE IDENTIFY YOURSELFI
TO A FLIGHT ATTENDANT FOR RESEATING. DO NOT REMOVE THIS CARD FROM THE AIRCRAFT
america

PASSENGER SELECTION CRITERIA
FOR EXIT SEATING
FEDERAL AVIATION REGULATIONS REQUIRE THAT PASSENGERS SEATED IN AN EXIT SEAT ARE ABLE TO PERFORM
THE EMERGENCY EXIT SEAT DUTIES AND MEET ALL SELECTION CRITERIA AS LISTED BELOW. AFTER REVIEWING
THIS SAFETY INFORMATION CARD, PLEASE IDENTIFY YOURSELF TO A CREW MEMBER FOR RESEATING IF YOU:
1. Cannot meet the selection criteria.
2. Have a condition, which is not apparent, that would prevent you from performing the duties listed.
3. May suffer bodily harm as a result of performing one or more of the duties listed.
4. Do not wish to perform the exit duties in the event of an emergency.
EMERGENCY EXIT SEAT DUTIES
IN THE EVENT OF AN EMERGENCY IN WHICH A CREW MEMBER IS NOT AVAILABLE TO ASSIST,
YOU MAY BE CALLED UPON TO PERFORM THE FOLLOWING DUTIES:
1. Locate the emergency exit.
2. Recognize the emergency exit opening mechanism.
3. Comprehend the instructions for operating the emergency exit.
4. Operate the emergency exit.
5. Assess whether opening the emergency exit will increase the hazards to which passengers may be exposed.
6. Follow oral directions (in English) and hand signals given by a crewmember.
7. Remove the window exit, slide it lengthwise out of the opening and push it away from the exit path outside.
8. Assess the condition of the escape slide, activate the slide, and stabilize the slide after deployment to assist others in getting off the slide.
9. Pass quickly through the emergency exit.
10. Assess, select, and follow a safe path away from the emergency exit.
SELECTION CRITERIA
YOU MAY NOT SIT IN AN EXIT SEAT IF YOU ARE UNABLE TO PERFORM THE
EMERGENCY EXIT SEAT DUTIES AS DESCRIBED ABOVE BECAUSE:
1. You lack sufficient mobility, strength, or dexterity in both arms and hands, and both legs.
® To reach upward, sideways, and downward to the location of emergency exits and exit-slide operating mechanisms.
* To grasp and push, pull, turn, or otherwise manipulate those mechanisms.
I To push, shove, pull, or otherwise open emergency exits.
I To liftout, hold, deposit on nearby seats, or maneuver over the seat backs to the next row objects the size
and weight of the overwing exit doors.
® To remove obstructions similar in size and weight to overwing exit doors.
v To reach the emergency exit quickly.
I To maintain balance while removing obstructions.
ViI To exit quickly.
® To stabilize an exitslide after deployment.
* To assist others in getting off an escape slide.
2. You are less than 15 years of age or lack the capacity to perform one or more of the applicable functions
without the assistance of an adult companion, parent, or other relative.
3. You lack the ability to read and understand printed or graphic instructions or the ability
to understand oral (in English) crew commands.
4. You lack the visual capacity to perform the duties without the assistance of visual aids beyond contact lenses or eyeglasses.
5. You lack sufficient aural capacity to hear and understand instructions shouted by flight attendants
without the assistance beyond a hearing aid.
6. You lack the ability to impart information orally to other passengers.
7. You have:
• A condition or responsibility, such as caring for a small child, that might prevent you
from performing one or more of the duties
I A condition that might cause you harm if you perform one or more of any of the duties.
©2008 Virgin America. Final assembly of this airplane was completed in Germany.
